columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the present value of the cash flow of the McCann Co. investment project if at a discount rate of 10%, 18%, and 24%.

In this calculation, we will consider the following anticipated cash flow from the investment:

| Year        | Amounts ($) |
|-------------|-------------|
| First-year  | 530         |
| Second-year | 690         |
| Third-year  | 875         |
| Fourth-year | 1090        |

The present cash flow value refers to the combined current value of the future cash flows. It is calculated by discounting each cash flow by a specific discount rate and combining the values from each year. Hence, in this computation, we will use the following formula for each period:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value} &=\dfrac{{FV}_{t}}{\left(1 + r\right)^{t}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$FV$, which refers to the cash flow
$t$, which represent the period
$r$, which indicate the discount rate

To deduce, we have determined the present value of the future cash flows by discounting each year and combining all the values. The result of our calculations shows the present value of McCann Co.'s investment:

| Discount rate | Present value |
|-----------------|---------------------------------|
| 10%             | $2,453.95                       |
| 18%             | $2,039.49                       |
| 24%             | $1,796.14                       |
